models.insights: An AI-generated correlation pattern that connects user habits to their results, showing how workouts and meals affect weight and strength trends.

relationships: Insights are generated by analyzing the user's WeightEntries, Workouts, Exercises, and Meals over time
Each Insight includes chart data points showing the correlation visually

insights.title: Rest days boost your lifts
insights.description: After taking a rest day, your next workout shows an average 8% increase in weight lifted across all exercises.

insights.title: Protein logging correlates with weight loss
insights.description: Weeks where you log protein with every meal show a 0.4 kg average weight decrease compared to weeks with inconsistent logging.

insights.title: More workouts, steadier weight
insights.description: When you train 4+ times per week, your weight fluctuates less day-to-day. Your variance drops from ±0.8 kg to ±0.3 kg.

insights.title: Leg days may affect next-day chest performance
insights.description: Your chest exercises show slightly lower volume the day after leg workouts. This could be due to overall fatigue.

insights.title: Morning weigh-ins are more consistent
insights.description: Weight entries logged before 9 AM show less variation than those logged later in the day.

insights.title: Arm strength improving fastest
insights.description: Your arm exercises show the highest rate of progressive overload over the past 30 days, with an average increase of 2 kg per session.
